root.name: init
tip: U: init [options]
Create an empty Git repository or reinitialize an existing repository.

options.name: -q
tip: U: -q, --quiet
Only print error and warning messages; all other output will be suppressed.

options.name: --bare
tip: Create a bare repository.
If GIT_DIR environment is not set, it is set to the current working directory.

options.name: --object-format
tip:
U: --object-format <format>
Specify the given object <format> (hash algorithm) for the repository.
The valid values are sha1 and (if enabled) sha256. sha1 is the default.

options.name: --ref-format=
tip: Specify the given ref storage <format> for the repository.

next.name: files
tip: files for loose files with packed-refs.
This is the default.

next.name: reftable
tip: reftable for the reftable format.
This format is experimental and its internals are subject to change.

options.name: --template
tip: U: --template <template-directory>
Specify a custom template directory for repository initialization.

options.name: --separate-git-dir
tip:
U: --separate-git-dir <git-dir>
Instead of initializing the repository as a directory to either $GIT_DIR or ./.git/, create a text file there containing the path to the actual repository.
This file acts as a filesystem-agnostic Git symbolic link to the repository.
If this is a reinitialization, the repository will be moved to the specified path.

options.name: -b
tip:
U: -b, --initial-branch <branch-name>
Use <branch-name> for the initial branch in the newly created repository.
If not specified, fall back to the default name.

options.name: --shared=
tip:
U: --shared[=(false|true|umask|group|all|world|everybody|<perm>)]
Specify that the Git repository is to be shared amongst several users.
This allows users belonging to the same group to push into that repository.

next.name: umask
tip: Use permissions reported by umask.
The default, when --shared is not specified.

next.name: group
tip: Make the repository group-writable, (and g+sx, since the git group may not be the primary group of all users).
This is used to loosen the permissions of an otherwise safe umask value.

next.name: all
tip: Same as group, but make the repository readable by all users.

root.name: clone
tip: Clone a repository into a new directory.

options.name: --sparse
tip: Employ a sparse-checkout, with only files in the toplevel directory initially being present.

options.name: -b
tip:
U: -b <branch>
Specify the branch to clone.
By default, git clone clones the main branch of the remote repository.

options.name: --depth
tip: U: --depth <n>
Specify the depth of commit history to clone.
Clone only the latest commit without historical commit records.

options.name: -j
tip: U: -j <n>
Specify the number of threads for parallel cloning to speed up the process.

root.name: add
tip: Add file changes to the index.
Add all changes in the current directory and its subdirectories (including new, modified, and deleted files) to the index.

options.name: -A
tip: U: -A, --all
Add all changes in the current working tree (including new, modified, and deleted files) to the index.

options.name: -f
tip: U: -f, --force
Allow adding ignored files.

options.name: -i
tip: U: -i, --interactive
Interactively add modified content from the working tree to the index.

options.name: -p
tip:
U: -p, --patch
Interactively choose chunks of content between the index and the working tree to add to the index.
Similar to git add -i but skips the initial command menu and goes directly to the patch subcommand.

options.name: -e
tip: U: -e, --edit
Open the diff and the index in an editor for further editing.

options.name: -u
tip: U: -u, --update
It will stage modifications and deletions of tracked files (files already in the Git repository) to the staging area, but it does not stage new files.

options.name: --refresh
tip: Don't add the file(s), but only refresh their stat() information in the index.

options.name: --ignore-errors
tip:
If some files could not be added because of errors indexing them, do not abort the operation, but continue adding the others.
The command shall still exit with non-zero status.
The configuration variable add.ignoreErrors can be set to true to make this the default behaviour.

root.name: commit
tip: Record changes to the repository.

options.name: -m
tip: U: -m <message>
Specify a descriptive message for the commit.

options.name: -a
tip: U: -a, --all
Automatically stage changes to tracked files in the index.

options.name: -e
tip: U: -e, --edit
Launch an editor to edit the commit message.

options.name: --no-edit
tip: Use the selected commit message without launching an editor.

options.name: --amend
tip: Modify the message of the last commit(Create a new commit, replacing the last one)

options.name: â€”allow-empty
tip: Usually recording a commit that has the exact same tree as its sole parent commit is a mistake, and the command prevents you from making such a commit.
This option bypasses the safety, and is primarily for use by foreign SCM interface scripts.

options.name: --date
tip: U: --date <date>
Set the author date for the commit.

next.name: (Get-Date)
tip: Use the current date and time.
Specify a date.
Specify a date and time.

options.name: --fixup
tip: Create a new commit which "fixes up" <commit> when applied with `git rebase --autosquash.`

options.name: --squash
tip: Construct a commit message for use with `rebase --autosquash`.

options.name: -p
tip: U: -p, --patch
Interactively choose which changes to commit.

options.name: -t
tip: U: -t <file>
Get the commit message from the given file and launch an editor for editing.

options.name: -F
tip: U: -F <file>
Get the commit message from the given file.

options.name: -C
tip: U: -C <commit>
Take an existing commit object and reuse the log message and author information when creating a commit (including timestamps)

options.name: --reset-author
tip: When used with -C/-c/--amend options, or when committing after a conflicting cherry-pick, declare that the authorship of the resulting commit now belongs to the committer.
This also renews the author timestamp.

options.name: --short
tip:
When doing a dry-run, give the output in the short-format.
See https://git-scm.com/docs/git-status for details.
Implies `--dry-run`.

options.name: --branch
tip: Show the branch and tracking info even in short-format.

options.name: --porcelain
tip:
When doing a dry-run, give the output in a porcelain-ready format.
See https://git-scm.com/docs/git-status for details.
Implies `--dry-run`.

options.name: --long
tip: When doing a dry-run, give the output in the long-format.
Implies `--dry-run`.

root.name: push
tip: Update remote references and associated objects.

options.name: --all
tip: push all branches

options.name: --tags
tip: push all tags

root.name: pull
tip: Fetch and merge from another repository or local branch.

options.name: --all
tip: fetch from all remotes

root.name: fetch
tip: Download objects and references from another repository.

options.name: --all
tip: fetch from all remotes

root.name: status
tip: Show the status of the working tree.

options.name: -s
tip: U: -s, --short
Show the output in a short format.

options.name: -b
tip: U: -b, --branch
Show branch and tracking information, even in short format.

options.name: --show-stash
tip: Show the number of hidden entries in the stash.

options.name: -v
tip: U: -v, --verbose
Show additional text changes to be committed.

options.name: -vv
tip: Show uncommitted changes in the working tree.

root.name: log
tip: Show commit logs.

options.name: -n
tip: U: -n <n>
Show the last n commit messages.

options.name: --show-signature
tip: Show the signature of each commit.

options.name: --graph
tip: Display branch and merge history in ASCII art alongside the log.

options.name: --oneline
tip: Display each commit message on one line.

options.name: --stat
tip: Show statistics about file modifications in each commit.
Each commit lists the modified files, added and removed lines, and a summary of all line changes at the end.

options.name: --shortstat
tip: Show only the summary line for --stat

options.name: -p
tip: Show each update's differences in patch format, more detailed than --stat

options.name: --name-only
tip: Show a list of modified files after the commit messages.

options.name: --name-status
tip: Show a list of added, modified, and deleted files.

options.name: --abbrev-commit
tip: Show only the first few characters of the SHA-1 checksum instead of the full 40 characters.

options.name: --relative-date
tip: Display dates in a shorter relative format instead of the full format (e.g. 2 weeks ago)

options.name: --pretty
tip: Display commit history in a custom format.

options.name: --pretty=oneline
tip: Display each commit message on one line, showing only the hash and commit message.

options.name: --pretty=short
tip: Display hash, Author, and commit info.

options.name: --pretty=full
tip: Display hash, Author, Commit, and commit info.

options.name: --pretty=fuller
tip: Display hash, Author, AuthorDate, Commit, CommitDate, and commit info.

options.name: --pretty=format:""
tip: Control the format of displayed information.

root.name: rebase
tip: Move local commits to the tip of an updated upstream branch.
Used to modify commit history, often to integrate commits from one branch into another.

options.name: -i
tip: U: -i, --interactive
Allows interactive rebase, enabling editing, merging, deleting, and more for each commit.

options.name: --onto
tip: U: --onto <new_base_branch>
Specify a new base branch to apply commits from the current branch onto.

options.name: --abort
tip: Cancel the ongoing rebase operation and return to the state before the rebase started.

options.name: --continue
tip: Continue the rebase operation, typically used after resolving conflicts.

options.name: --skip
tip: Skip the current commit and continue the rebase operation.

options.name: --merge
tip: Merge a branch into the target branch instead of applying commits sequentially.

options.name: -x
tip: U: -x <cmd>
Execute a specified command after each commit is applied, useful for automation such as testing and linting.

options.name: -p
tip: Preserve the structure of merge commits to maintain merge history.

root.name: branch
tip: List, create, or delete branches.

options.name: -a
tip: List all branches, including local and remote branches.

options.name: -d
tip: U: -d <branch>
Delete the specified branch.

options.name: -D
tip: U: -D <branch>
Force delete the specified branch.

options.name: -m
tip: U: -m <old_branch> <new_branch>
Rename the specified branch.

options.name: -M
tip: U: -M <old_branch> <new_branch>
Force rename the specified branch.

options.name: -v
tip: View local branches with their last commit information.

options.name: -vv
tip: View local branches with their last commit information and their relationship to branches and remote branches.

root.name: checkout
tip:
Switch branches or paths in the working tree.
E: checkout <branch>           --- Switch branches
   checkout <commit_hash>      --- Switch to a specific commit
   checkout -b <new_branch>    --- Create and switch to a new branch
Switch to the previous branch.

options.name: -b
tip: U: -b <new_branch>
Create and switch to a new branch

options.name: -B
tip: U: -B <new_branch>
Forcefully create (overwrite if the branch exists) and switch to a branch

options.name: --orphan
tip: U: --orphan <new_branch>
Create a new orphan branch
Discard all changes in the working directory; the index is preserved.

options.name: -f
tip: Forcefully discard changes in both the index and the working directory.

root.name: switch
tip: Switch branches.

options.name: -c
tip: U: -c, --create <new_branch>
Create a new branch and switch to it.
Switch to the previously switched branch.

options.name: -f
tip:
Proceed even if the index or the working tree differs from HEAD.
Both the index and working tree are restored to match the switching target.
If --recurse-submodules is specified, submodule content is also restored to match the switching target.
This is used to throw away local changes.

root.name: merge
tip: Merge two or more development histories.

options.name: --squash
tip: Compresses the merge result into a single commit and does not preserve the commit history of the source branch.
Then you need to specify a new commit message.

options.name: --continue
tip: Continue the current merge operation.

options.name: --abort
tip: Abort the merge and return to the original state.

options.name: --quit
tip: Keep the current conflicts and exit the merge.

root.name: diff
tip:
Display changes between commits, changes between commits and the working tree, and more.
E: diff <file>                --- Show differences between the specified file in the working directory and the index.
   diff <commit1> <commit2>   --- Compare differences between two commits.
   diff <branch1> <branch2>   --- Compare differences between two branches.

options.name: --staged
tip: Compare differences between the index and the latest commit.

options.name: --color-words
tip: Compare word differences between the working directory and the latest commit.

root.name: reflog
tip: Manage reflog information.

next.name: show
tip: Display the commit history in the reflog.

next.name: delete
tip: Remove entries from the reflog.

next.name: expire
tip: Remove older reflog entries.

next.name: exists
tip: Check if a ref has an associated reflog entry.

root.name: remote
tip: Manage remote repositories in a Git repository.

next.name: add
tip: Add a new remote repository.

next.name: rename
tip: Rename a remote repository.

options.name: --progress
tip: force progress reporting

next.name: rm
tip: U: rm, remove <repository>
Remove a remote repository.

next.name: set-head
tip: Set the default branch on a remote repository.

next.name: set-branches
tip: Set the list of branches to track on a remote repository.

next.name: get-url
tip: Display the URL of a remote repository.

next.name: set-url
tip: Change the URL of a remote repository.

next.name: show
tip: Display information about remote repositories.

next.name: prune
tip: Remove stale references from remote repositories.

next.name: update
tip: Fetch updates from remote repositories.

options.name: -v
tip: List the currently configured remote repositories and display their URLs.

root.name: tag
tip:
Create, list, delete, or verify tags with or without GPG signatures.
E: tag [-l|--list]   --- List tags
   tag v1.0.0        --- Create a tag
   tag  -d v1.0.0    --- Delete a tag

options.name: -l
tip:
U: -l, --list [pattern]
List tags (can use wildcards)
E: -l v1.0*

options.name: -n
tip:
U: -n[num]
[num] specifies how many lines from the annotation, if any, are printed when using -l. Implies --list.
The default is not to print any annotation lines. If no number is given to -n, only the first line is printed. If the tag is not annotated, the commit message is displayed instead.

options.name: -a
tip:
U: -a, --annotate <tag>
Create an annotated tag object.
E: -a v1.0.0

options.name: -d
tip: U: -d, --delete <tag>
Delete tags.

options.name: -v
tip: U: -v, --verify <tag>
Verify tags

root.name: config
tip: Retrieve and configure repository or global options.

next.name: user.name
tip: Configure the username.
E: [--global] user.name xxx

next.name: user.email
tip: Configure the email.
E: [--global] user.email xxx@outlook.com

next.name: core.editor
tip: Configure the default editor.

next.name: "code --wait"
tip: Configure the default editor as vscode.

next.name: vim
tip: Configure the default editor as vim.

next.name: nvim
tip: Configure the default editor as nvim.

next.name: notepad
tip: Configure the default editor as Notepad (Microsoft Notepad).

next.name: core.ignorecase
tip: Configure the case-sensitivity of file names.
The default is false, except git-clone or git-init will probe and set core.ignoreCase true if appropriate when the repository is created.

next.name: https.proxy
tip:
Configure the Git https proxy.
E: [--global] https.proxy 127.0.0.1:10810   --- Set proxy
   [--global] --unset https.proxy           --- Unset proxy

next.name: user.signingkey
tip: Configure the GPG signing key.

next.name: gpg.program
tip: Configure the GPG program path.

next.name: commit.gpgsign
tip: Configure whether to sign commits with GPG.

next.name: true
tip: Sign commits with GPG.

next.name: false
tip: Don't sign commits with GPG.

next.name: commit.template
tip: Configure the default commit template.
E: [--global] commit.template ~/.gitmessage

next.name: color.ui
tip: Configure the command auto-coloring.

next.name: true
tip: Enable command auto-coloring configuration.

next.name: false
tip: Disable command auto-coloring configuration.

next.name: color.status
tip: Configure the auto-coloring for the status command.

next.name: auto
tip: Default value.
Automatically determine whether to enable color display based on terminal support.

next.name: always
tip: Always enable color display, regardless of terminal support.

next.name: never
tip: Never enable color display, even if the terminal supports it.

next.name: color.diff
tip: Configure the auto-coloring for the diff command.

next.name: auto
tip: Default value.
Automatically determine whether to enable color display based on terminal support.

next.name: always
tip: Always enable color display, regardless of terminal support.

next.name: never
tip: Never enable color display, even if the terminal supports it.

next.name: color.branch
tip: Configure the auto-coloring for the branch command.

next.name: auto
tip: Default value.
Automatically determine whether to enable color display based on terminal support.

next.name: always
tip: Always enable color display, regardless of terminal support.

next.name: never
tip: Never enable color display, even if the terminal supports it.

next.name: color.interactive
tip: Configure the auto-coloring for the -i (interactive) command.

next.name: auto
tip: Default value.
Automatically determine whether to enable color display based on terminal support.

next.name: always
tip: Always enable color display, regardless of terminal support.

next.name: never
tip: Never enable color display, even if the terminal supports it.

options.name: --global
tip: Perform global settings.

options.name: -e
tip: U: -e, --edit
Edit the configuration for the current repository.

options.name: --unset
tip: Remove config.
E: [--global] --unset user.name

next.name: user.name
tip: Remove config --- the username.

next.name: user.email
tip: Remove config --- the email.

next.name: core.editor
tip: Remove config --- the default editor.

next.name: https.proxy
tip: Remove config --- the Git https proxy.

next.name: user.signingkey
tip: Remove config --- the GPG signing key.

next.name: gpg.program
tip: Remove config --- the GPG program path.

next.name: commit.gpgsign
tip: Remove config --- whether to sign commits with GPG.

next.name: commit.template
tip: Remove config --- the default commit template.

next.name: color.ui
tip: Remove config --- the command auto-coloring.

next.name: color.status
tip: Remove config --- the auto-coloring for the status command.

next.name: color.diff
tip: Remove config --- the auto-coloring for the diff command.

next.name: color.branch
tip: Remove config --- the auto-coloring for the branch command.

next.name: color.interactive
tip: Remove config --- the auto-coloring for the -i (interactive) command.

options.name: --get
tip: Get config value (Usually can be omitted)
E: [--global] [--get] user.name

root.name: stash
tip:
Stash changes in the stash.
Note: When there're multiple stashes, they're ordered from newest to oldest, and the index is starting from 0.
      If the index is omitted, the first stash is operated by default. (stash@{0})

next.name: list
tip: List all stashes.

next.name: show
tip:
U: show [<index>]
To show other stashes, specify an index.
index: Represents the index of the stash, starting from 0.
E: show 1   --- Show the second stash. (stash@{1})

options.name: -p
tip: Show the diff of the stash.

next.name: pop
tip:
U: pop [<index>]
Apply and remove changes from the stash.
The difference from 'apply' is that 'pop' removes the stash after applying.
E: pop 1   --- Pop the second stash. (stash@{1})

next.name: apply
tip:
U: apply [<index>]
Apply changes from the stash.
The difference from 'pop' is that 'apply' doesn't remove the stash.
E: apply 1   --- Apply the second stash. (stash@{1})

next.name: push
tip: Stash changes (equivalent to 'git stash').

options.name: -m
tip: Specify a descriptive message for this stash.
E: -m "Remark" (equivalent to 'git stash -m "Remark"')

next.name: drop
tip:
U: drop [<index>]
Remove a single stash.
E: drop 1   ---  Remove the second stash. (stash@{1})

next.name: clear
tip: Clear the stash.

options.name: -m
tip: Specify a descriptive message for this stash.
E: -m "Remark"

root.name: reset
tip: Reset the current HEAD to a specified commit.

options.name: --soft
tip: Move HEAD to a specified commit, keeping changes in both the working directory and the staging area (index).

options.name: --mixed
tip: Default behavior: Move HEAD to a specified commit and move changes from both the working directory and the staging area to the working directory.

options.name: --hard
tip: Move HEAD to a specified commit and remove all changes, including those in the working directory and the index. Be cautious, as this is irreversible.

root.name: cherry
tip: Find commits in the local commit list that have not been pushed to the remote and display their hash values.

options.name: -v
tip: Display hash values and commit messages.

root.name: cherry-pick
tip:
Pick a specified commit from another branch and apply it to the current branch.
E: cherry-pick <commit1>             ---  Pick commit1
   cherry-pick <commit1..commit2>    ---  Pick all commits between commit1 and commit2 (excluding commit1)
   cherry-pick <commit1^..commit2>   ---  Pick all commits between commit1 and commit2 (including commit1)

options.name: --continue
tip: Continue the merge (you should have resolved conflicts before using this command).

options.name: --abort
tip: Abort the cherry-pick operation and return to the original state.

options.name: --quit
tip: Keep the current conflicts and exit the cherry-pick.

root.name: rm
tip: Delete the specified file from the working directory and stage the deletion.

options.name: -f
tip: Forcefully delete the specified file from the working directory, even if it has been modified and staged.

options.name: --cached
tip: Stop tracking the specified file (remove the specified file from the index), but keep it in the working directory.

root.name: mv
tip: Move or rename a file, directory, or symbolic link, and stage the change.

options.name: -f
tip: Forcefully move or rename a file, directory, or symbolic link, and stage the change.

root.name: show
tip:
Show information related to the current commit and changes to files
E: show                 --- Show HEAD
   show <commit_hash>   --- Show the commit

root.name: shortlog
tip: Summarize Git log output.

root.name: show-branch
tip: Display branches and their commits.

root.name: revert
tip: U: revert <commit-hash>
Undo changes made by a specified commit (creates a new commit).

root.name: annotate
tip: Display authorship and last modification commit information for each line in a file, along with the line's content

root.name: format-patch
tip: Create patches, where N represents how many patches to generate (one patch per commit).
E: format-patch -2   ---  Generate two patch files (xxx.patch) from the latest two commits.

root.name: am
tip: Apply patches.

options.name: --show-current-patch=diff
tip: View failed patches.

options.name: --continue
tip: U: --continue, --resolved
Continue applying patches (you should have resolved conflicts before using this command).

options.name: --skip
tip: Skip this patch.

options.name: --abort
tip: Abort applying patches and restore the original state.

root.name: apply
tip: Apply patches to files and/or the index.

options.name: --reject
tip: U: --reject <patch_file>
Automatically merge non-conflicting code changes from the patch while generating conflicting content as xxx.rej files.

root.name: clean
tip: Remove untracked files from the working tree.

root.name: count-objects
tip: Count unpacked objects and display their disk usage.

options.name: -H
tip: U: -H, --human-readable
Print sizes in human-readable format.

options.name: -v
tip: U: -v, --verbose
Also report the number of packed objects and objects that can be removed.

root.name: flow
tip: Manage branches and development workflows.

next.name: init
tip: Initialize a new Git repository with a branching model.

next.name: feature
tip: Manage feature branches.

next.name: bugfix
tip: Manage bugfix branches.

next.name: release
tip: Manage release branches.

next.name: hotfix
tip: Manage hotfix branches.

next.name: support
tip: Manage support branches.

next.name: version
tip: Display version information.

next.name: config
tip: Manage Git-flow configuration.

next.name: log
tip: Display logs that don't match the base branch.

root.name: lfs
tip: Work with large files in Git repositories.

next.name: checkout
tip: Populate working copy with real content from Git LFS files.

next.name: completion
tip: Generate shell scripts for command-line tab-completion of Git LFS commands.

next.name: dedup
tip: De-duplicate Git LFS files.

next.name: env
tip: Display the Git LFS environment.

next.name: ext
tip: Display Git LFS extension details.

next.name: fetch
tip: Download Git LFS files from a remote.

next.name: fsck
tip: Check Git LFS files for consistency.

next.name: install
tip: Install Git LFS configuration.

next.name: lock
tip: Set a file as "locked" on the Git LFS server.

next.name: locks
tip: List currently "locked" files from the Git LFS server.

next.name: logs
tip: Show errors from the Git LFS command.

next.name: ls-files
tip: Show information about Git LFS files in the index and working tree.

next.name: migrate
tip: Migrate history to or from Git LFS.

next.name: prune
tip: Delete old Git LFS files from local storage.

next.name: pull
tip: Fetch Git LFS changes from the remote & checkout any required working tree files.

next.name: push
tip: Push queued large files to the Git LFS endpoint.

next.name: status
tip: Show the status of Git LFS files in the working tree.

next.name: track
tip: View or add Git LFS paths to Git attributes.

next.name: uninstall
tip: Uninstall Git LFS by removing hooks and smudge/clean filter configuration.

next.name: unlock
tip: Remove "locked" setting for a file on the Git LFS server.

next.name: untrack
tip: Remove Git LFS paths from Git Attributes.

next.name: update
tip: Update Git hooks for the current Git repository.

next.name: version
tip: Report the version number.

root.name: prune
tip: Remove all unreachable objects from the object database.

root.name: grep
tip: Print lines matching a pattern.

root.name: gc
tip: Clean unnecessary files and optimize the local repository.

root.name: archimport
tip: Import an Arch repository into Git.

root.name: archive
tip: Create a file archive from a named tree.

tip: Mark the current or given revision as bad.

tip: Mark the current or given revision as good.

tip: Display help messages.

tip: Mark the current or given revision as old, indicating a bad state.

options.name: --version
tip: Prints the Git suite version that the git program came from.
If --help is also given, it takes precedence over --version.

options.name: -C
tip:
U: -C <path>
Run as if git was started in <path> instead of the current working directory.
If <path> is present but empty, e.g. -C "", then the current working directory is left unchanged.

options.name: -c
tip:
U: -c <name>=<value>
Pass a configuration parameter to the command. The value given will override values from configuration files.
The <name> is expected in the same format as listed by git config (subkeys separated by dots).

options.name: --exec-path
tip:
U: --exec-path [<path>]
Path to wherever your core Git programs are installed.
This can also be controlled by setting the GIT_EXEC_PATH environment variable.
If no path is given, git will print the current setting and then exit.

options.name: --html-path
tip: Print the path, without trailing slash, where Git's HTML documentation is installed and exit.

options.name: --man-path
tip: Print the manpath for the man pages for this version of Git and exit.

options.name: --info-path
tip: Print the path where the Info files documenting this version of Git are installed and exit.

options.name: -p
tip: Pipe all output into less (or if set, $PAGER) if standard output is a terminal.
This overrides the pager.<cmd> configuration options.

options.name: -P
tip: Do not pipe Git output into a pager.

options.name: --git-dir
tip:
U: --git-dir <path>
Set the path to the repository (".git" directory).
This can also be controlled by setting the GIT_DIR environment variable.
It can be an absolute path or relative path to current working directory.

options.name: --work-tree
tip:
U: --work-tree <path>
Set the path to the working tree. It can be an absolute path or a path relative to the current working directory.
This can also be controlled by setting the GIT_WORK_TREE environment variable and the core.worktree configuration variable

options.name: --namespace
tip:
U: --namespace <path>
Set the Git namespace.
Equivalent to setting the GIT_NAMESPACE environment variable.

options.name: --bare
tip: Treat the repository as a bare repository.
If GIT_DIR environment is not set, it is set to the current working directory.

options.name: --no-replace-objects
tip: Do not use replacement refs to replace Git objects.
This is equivalent to exporting the GIT_NO_REPLACE_OBJECTS environment variable with any value.

options.name: --no-lazy-fetch
tip:
Do not fetch missing objects from the promisor remote on demand.
Useful together with git cat-file -e <object> to see if the object is locally available.
This is equivalent to setting the GIT_NO_LAZY_FETCH environment variable to 1.

options.name: --no-optional-locks
tip: Do not perform optional operations that require locks.
This is equivalent to setting the GIT_OPTIONAL_LOCKS to 0.

options.name: --no-advice
tip: Disable all advice hints from being printed.

options.name: --literal-pathspecs
tip: Treat pathspecs literally (i.e. no globbing, no pathspec magic).
This is equivalent to setting the GIT_LITERAL_PATHSPECS environment variable to 1.

options.name: --glob-pathspecs
tip:
Add "glob" magic to all pathspec.
This is equivalent to setting the GIT_GLOB_PATHSPECS environment variable to 1.
Disabling globbing on individual pathspecs can be done using pathspec magic ":(literal)"

options.name: --noglob-pathspecs
tip:
Add "literal" magic to all pathspec.
This is equivalent to setting the GIT_NOGLOB_PATHSPECS environment variable to 1.
Enabling globbing on individual pathspecs can be done using pathspec magic ":(glob)"

options.name: --icase-pathspecs
tip: Add "icase" magic to all pathspec.
This is equivalent to setting the GIT_ICASE_PATHSPECS environment variable to 1.

options.name: --list-cmds
tip:
U: --list-cmds <group>[,<group>â€¦â€‹]
List commands by group.
This is an internal/experimental option and may change or be removed in the future.

options.name: --attr-source
tip:
U: --attr-source <tree-ish>
Read gitattributes from <tree-ish> instead of the worktree.
This is equivalent to setting the GIT_ATTR_SOURCE environment variable.

common_options.name: --help
tip:
U: --help, -h
Prints the synopsis and a list of the most commonly used commands.
If the option --all or -a is given then all available commands are printed.
If a Git command is named this option will bring up the manual page for that command.

config.name: max_commit
tip: $_value = $PSCompletions.config.comp_config.git.max_commit;
if($_value -ne $null){ "Current Value: <@Magenta>$_value<@Blue>`n" }
The maximum number that can be parsed for a project commit by the hooks. Default to <@Magenta>20<@Blue>.
If it is <@Magenta>-1<@Blue>, all commits will be parsed, which may affect the loading speed.
